info.description: Postman collection for testing bidirectional Jira-NestJS integration POC

item.name: Products

request.description:
Create a new product. This will:
1. Create product in MySQL
2. Create corresponding Jira issue
3. Store jiraIssueKey and jiraIssueId

If Jira creation fails, product is still created with jiraSyncStatus=FAILED

Get a product by ID with live Jira ticket status.

Response includes:
- Product data from MySQL
- ticket: { key, status, summary, updated, assignee }
- jiraFetchStatus if Jira unavailable

Update a product by ID. Updates MySQL and syncs to Jira.

- If product has jiraIssueKey: updates Jira issue
- If product has no jiraIssueKey: creates new Jira issue
- Partial updates supported (name, description, externalRef)

Soft delete a product and transition linked Jira issue to 'Dropped' status.

- Sets deletedAt timestamp in MySQL
- Transitions Jira issue to configured 'Dropped' status
- Continues with soft delete even if Jira transition fails

item.name: Jira Webhook

request.description:
Inbound webhook endpoint for Jira Automation.

Configure in Jira Automation:
- Trigger: Issue Updated / Transitioned
- Action: Send Web Request → POST {BACKEND_URL}/jira/webhook

Updates product fields based on Jira issue key:
- ticketStatus ← status.name
- name ← summary (optional)
- description ← description (optional)

Full payload is logged for traceability.

Example webhook payload for issue status transition.

Use this format when configuring Jira Automation to trigger on status changes.
